com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.status

Class WZState

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.status.WZState

  • public class WZState
extends Object
    The WZState class provides identifiers that indicate the state of various components and operations within the SDK.

    The state property of the WZStatus class is used primarily to inquire status and state information when using the SDK APIs.

    Usage example: Live streaming broadcast state transitions

    A live streaming broadcast transitions between states like so:
    IDLE
    This is the normal SDK state, just before a broadcast is initiated.
    STARTING
    The SDK broadcast components (e.g. camera, microphone, server connection) are being initialized.
    READY
    The SDK components have successfully been initialized, indicating the broadcast can begin.
    RUNNING
    A live streaming broadcast is active. Video and/or audio are being captured, encoded, and transmitted to the streaming server.
    STOPPING
    The broadcast is ending and the broadcast components are being shutdown (e.g. the server connection is being closed).
    PAUSED
    The associated component is in a paused state.
    This state transition can be monitored at the application level through the use for a WZStatusCallback that is supplied to as an argument to the primary startStreaming API call.
    See Also:
    WZStatus, WZStatusCallback
